#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Investigate the Perception Aggregate
#Text=Perception is actually a very subtle one to watch , because you can get an idea of it intellectually , but only until you see it will you see what 's going on .
#Text=While this does require a strong background in mindfulness or awareness of the sequence of rapid mental events , complete beginners can do this with the focus just on perception .
#Text=Here 's what to look for .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Read Investigate the Feeling Aggregate or other similar works on the subject .
#Text=Feeling and perceptions are very closely linked .
#Text=Select a comfortable meditation posture .
#Text=You can do this in day to day circumstances , but this one is harder to see as its usually buried under all the other feelings and senses .
#Text=Examine whatever feelings arise .
#Text=Try to see the process of " recognition " or " awareness " or any words that mean knowing that a feeling has happened .
#Text=Study the recognition of those feelings - how , where , when and why .
#Text=The aim of the game is to see the micro-processes in action .
#Text=Think about this .

#Text=Feeling requires contact of the body ( nerve endings etc ) and the sense object ( such as tension , body chemicals , sound , sight , taste etc ) , if there is no perception of the contact or feeling , the mind does n't recognize either and feeling just does n't register .
#Text=Look for the distinction or separation as well as the link connection between feelings and what happens afterwards in the mind .
#Text=That distinction & link is perception .
#Text=Consider the accuracy of it , is it 100 % accurate and perceives everything ?
#Text=Understand the order that it arises :
#Text=first materiality - the body , physical objects and their characteristics ,
#Text=then feeling ,
#Text=then perception ,
#Text=then mental fabrications , activities , constructions , formations , responses or any word that works for you .
#Text=After that comes the conscious states or any words that describes the mental states that support and dominate the others .
#Text=Try to see it happen in action .
#Text=Trying to understand does not make understanding happen , although exploring the ideas can start the process .
#Text=Try to consider why there is only 5 of these aggregates and explore things that happen .
#Text=You might find everything slots into these 5 .
#Text=Consider these 3 similes .
#Text=They are more for the serious investigator of this subject , but make sense when you test them .

#Text=Materiality is like the sick room and the patient , feeling is the affliction of the sickness , perception is the provoking of the illness ( because it makes you want it to go away ) , formations is the wanting of it to go away and the consciousness is like an incurable illness because it is n't ever free of feeling .
#Text=Materiality is the prison , feeling is the punishment , perception is the crime , mental formations are the punisher and the consciousness the punished .

#Text=Materiality is like a lump of atomic foam , feeling like a bubble on the water ( because it does n't last ) , perception is a mirage because it makes illusions ( perception of the " me , mine " etc ) , mental formations like a banana or plantain trunk , because while it grows it does n't have a core of solid heartwood .
#Text=Consciousness is like a stage illusion .
#Text=It is n't ever how it seems .
#Text=Finally consider the " un-manageability " or the " auto-pilot " nature of perception .
#Text=It s not something we can turn on or off .

#Text=When someone who studies perceptions with the angle of testing ownership , self or entity , they can make a breakthrough this way as they 'll see the starting blocks of new thoughts , feelings and mental processes and that they are empty of any entity .
#Text=Then illusions are broken and there are no mysteries left .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Take it a step at a time .
#Text=It gets easier when you know what you are looking for as well as what you are seeing .
#Text=This really does take time .
#Text=Perception is n't easy to see because its in between contact , feeling and the response to feeling .
#Text=You have to break things down first to see it .
#Text=Perception is 9/10th 's of the law .
#Text=That is , " The Law " within each of us which is the basis of our understanding of all things external to ourselves .
#Text=We form ad follow this individually based on our perception of the world , the people in it and factions involved from early childhood .
#Text=What most fail to do to this day , is to ' Walk a mile in someone else 's moccasins ' , which is to see from someone else 's perspective .
#Text=This lends insight , compassion , understanding , and discernment in place of judgementalism , prejudice and intolerance of our fellow man .

#Text=Furthermore , egotism and self-centeredness , which are foundational to mental instability and civil unrest , are too easily fostered when we to limit our perception and fail to take others ' into consideration .
